comments.body: Is this #if unncessary? Same for other similar ones.

I think this one is still necessary. Since the implementation depends on `gpu::CudnnSupport` which is defined in cuda_dnn.h. For the cuda_dnn.h, it includes the `tensorflow/stream_executor/cuda/cuda_activation.h` which requires cuda config: e.g. https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/stream_executor/cuda/BUILD#L389

ditto - can we simplify these overloadings using the parameter struct I mentioned above? Also, is it easy to make data types / compute types template parameters, or even runtime types? Again, I'd weigh towards simplicity of the signature, as these functions are called for maybe twice throughout Tensorflow.
I've now done this with runtime types the same way as in blas.h. I had to add some helper code to work around minor issues that came up with logging and type deduction.
I since realized that this wasn't actually calling the template version of DoBlasLtMatmul any more. I've now refactored it again so that it's a template implementation with explicit instantiations.
